file_content.text: I told you, Karish-Ma, the Gormak are just as much a threat to us. They stole parts from our supply depot.
Thanks for taking care of that bomb for us. The Gormak are a threat to all civilized peoples.
Only threats to Voss matter. We asked for the bomb, you did not help.
It's better this way, Karish-Ma. Gormak technology would only corrupt the Voss.
I brought back a few pieces of the Gormak bomb.
These markings. Imperial technology, not Gormak.
The Gormak raided our supply dumps. They stole the parts to make the bomb from us.
Unacceptable. You should not have this technology.
We didn't bring this weapon to your planet. These are... hyperdrive parts that the Gormak stole and modified to use as a bomb.
I'll let you handle this.
I won't forget this. The Empire will see you well-rewarded for your actions.
The Gormak are a threat to everyone; they've been raiding us since we arrived.
The captain is right.
Clever Gormak, sowing distrust among us.
Exactly. Allow me to make a good-faith gesture, Karish-Ma, and put your mind at ease.
I thought we were in trouble when you brought those bomb parts back, but I should be able to salvage this. You'll be duly rewarded.
I've been straight with you, brought your bomb, and all you can do is make accusations?
You Voss are ungrateful scum.
Don't help. You've done quite enough already.
We appreciate your revelations.
The Gormak bomb won't be a threat to anyone, now.
You disappoint. I wanted to study.
I'm certain you'll come to see this was the best decision for everyone. If the bomb wasn't destroyed, the Gormak would try to retake it.
Perhaps. Thank you.
I hope my assistance helps bring the Voss and the Empire closer together.
Helping the Voss helps us all.
Destroying the bomb was quick thinking on your part, and it was the right thing to do.
It wasn't that difficult.
No, Karish-Ma is right. You've saved a lot of lives taking care of that bomb, and not a moment too soon.
I'm finished here.
The Empire appreciates everything you've done to keep the Voss safe.
I want to see the bomb.
These things take time, Karish-Ma. The bomb will be destroyed soon, I assure you.
My lord, may I have the pleasure of introducing Karish-Ma. He's got a few concerns you should know about.
A freelancer--that's very handy. Karish-Ma here's got some concerns about the Gormak that you are perfectly positioned to help with.
Sir! This is Karish-Ma. He's got a few issues with the Gormak that I could use your help with.
Most everyone's up in Gorma-Koss, and I need someone fast and discreet.
You I know. You serve the Voss well. Help us again.
We need your help. Stop the Gormak.
Keeping the Voss happy is in all our interests.
How may I help the Voss?
Words are meaningless. Eliminate the threat.
I can't help until I understand the situation.
I need to know more, Captain.
Allies or not, your people don't give me instructions.
I don't take orders from Voss.
The Voss are valuable friends; a threat to them endangers everything the Empire has worked for here.
We've reliable intelligence that the Gormak are developing a baradium bomb; that explosion would vaporize a city the size of Voss-Ka.
I need someone to slip into the Gormak's factory and take care of the bomb before they can use it.
The Gormak and their little toy won't make it through the day.
I'll handle this myself.
The Sith are true friends to the Voss; I'll be happy to destroy the Gormak's bomb.
For the Voss, I'll handle it.
A Gormak bomb that powerful is a threat to us all. I'll take care of it.
Sensible enough.
I'll handle the Gormak, Karish-Ma; the bomb's good as destroyed.
I'll deal with the Gormak.
A device the size you're describing seems beyond even them.
Where did they get a bomb?
Yes. Bring me the bomb. We must study it.
I don't care if these savages wipe each other out.
Sounds like a Voss problem.
This bomb is a threat to us all. It has to be destroyed.
Do not destroy. Collect. We must study the bomb.
We've been over this--the bomb's too dangerous, it can't be transported. There's no way for you to study it.
Besides, bringing such a weapon here would corrupt the purity of the Voss; it's better to destroy it.
Once I see the bomb, I'll have a better idea--maybe I can bring part of it back.
I'll bring it back if I can.
You may change your mind once you get inside the factory.
It'll be better for everyone if the bomb is out of the picture.
Destroying the bomb is safer.
Bring the bomb, outsider. I must see it.
It's not worth risking lives just to move it. I trust you'll make the right decision.
Not my concern. [Refuse quest]
Thanks for making my job even harder. I'll remember this.
Trust me, Karish-Ma, the Gormak are less of a threat than you think. We have our best personnel dealing with them.
Gormak are cunning. You cannot understand.
